str2: Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Strengthened from the base of trope; to twist, i.e. Turn quite around or reverse.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to look closely at, i.e. perceive; by extension to visit.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To accompany, attend, follow. Properly, to be in the same way with, i.e. To accompany.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To seek, search for, desire, require, demand. Of uncertain affinity; to seek; specially, to worship, or to plot.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Of Hebrew origin; my master, i.e Rabbi, as an official title of honor.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: To translate (from one language into another), interpret. From meta and hermeneuo; to explain over, i.e. Translate.
A teacher, master. From didasko; an instructor.
Genitive case of an interrogative pronoun pos otherwise obsolete; as adverb of place; at what locality.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await. A primary verb; to stay.
